intro: Chamaerhodiola algida, commonly known as the alpine tea, is a flowering plant native to the cold regions of the Arctic and alpine tundras. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically has succulent leaves that help it retain moisture in harsh, dry environments. It thrives in nutrient-poor soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Chamaerhodiola algida is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
